text: Douglas Nqobile Nyaupembe (born 2 October 1999) is an English footballer who plays for Radcliffe, having played as a defender for Bury until the end of the 2018–19 season. Having joined Bury as an under-13 player, he progressed through the club's youth teams and captained the team which won the Lancashire Senior Cup in 2018. Nyaupembe made his first team debut for Bury on 5 May 2018 when he was a 65th minute substitute in the EFL League One match against A.F.C. Wimbledon. He signed a professional contract with Bury later in the month. In the 2018–19 season, he was selected in the starting lineup for the EFL Trophy match against Leicester City U-21 on Tuesday, 16 October, playing on the right side of midfield. He then joined Hyde United from 2 November 2018 on a short-term development loan. He played in one match for Hyde, against Marine, and returned to Bury in December before commencing his loan to Stalybridge on 11 January 2019.
